originalText.text: Since KKR acquired the company my s/o works for, my partner is working 70-80 hour weeks, at the detriment of our young family. For a "leading" investment firm, it is beyond me how KKR can acquire companies with no forward planning, deploy executives who will deliver results at any cost,  whilst work/life balance is not even an afterthought. Perhaps KKR's disregard for the wellbeing of its non-executive staff explains to some extent its success, as employees work themselves into the ground so the shareholders can rejoice.

text.text: Since KKR acquired the company my s/o works for, my partner is working 70-80 hour weeks, at the detriment of our young family. For a "leading" investment firm, it is beyond me how KKR can acquire companies with no forward planning, deploy executives who will deliver results at any cost,  whilst work/life balance is not even an afterthought. Perhaps KKR's disregard for the wellbeing of its non-executive staff explains to some extent its success, as employees work themselves into the ground so the shareholders can rejoice.

originalText.text:
Kudos to KKR and Pete Stavros to make stock ownership of their target companies a reality for the rank and file hourly workers. This will, for example with their CHI Overhead Door investment and recent sale to Nucor, put $20,000 to $800,000 apiece (before taxes) in each employees pockets. Is KKR perfect and will
It appease all their ESG critics? No, but way to go Pete and KKR for making huge strides in spreading the wealth!

originalText.text: Trampling Indigenous rights and eating into shareholder dividends on the wrong infrastructure. Coastal Gas Link will never be built through unceded, unsurrendered Wet’suwet’en land. Divest now and protect your margins.

text.text: Trampling Indigenous rights and eating into shareholder dividends on the wrong infrastructure. Coastal Gas Link will never be built through unceded, unsurrendered Wet’suwet’en land. Divest now and protect your margins.

originalText.text: Their funding of the Coastal GasLink pipeline completely disregards the rights, lands and communities of the Wet'suwet'en Nation. A DISGRACE!

text.text: Their funding of the Coastal GasLink pipeline completely disregards the rights, lands and communities of the Wet'suwet'en Nation. A DISGRACE!

originalText.text: The front of the bldg. is cold and dead. It needs more green. Get rid of some cement.  I have no comment about financial planners.
